sub_title: Currently pursuing Msc at Erasmus University Rotterdam
summary: I am currently a pre-master student, on track to obtain my Msc in Financial Investments at Erasmus Universiteit, with a bachelors in International Business and a minor in trading digital financial assets, which I chose due to my interests in Fintech and venture capitals. In my experience as a finance intern at ASML, I grew a passion for financial process improvements, analysing data to fuel decision making, and providing strategic recommendations for real-life business challenges. I excel working in international, and culturally diverse environments due to my mixed background of South African, Portuguese, Greek, and English parents, living in South Africa and migrating to Cyprus, while continuing my studies in the Netherlands.

school.name: De Haagse Hogeschool / The Hague University of Applied Sciences

projects.title: Integrated Project: Internal Business Consultancy
projects.description: In this project, sponsored by the Hague University of Applied Sciences as a coursework project, we researched and produced an evidence-based solution on the ‘Usage of Digital Platforms in Order to Improve Online Communication’ for the given business problem by using appropriate research techniques and methodology. we evaluated our efforts with regard to performing research, as well as our interaction and coordination with all the stakeholders of this project while developing professional behavior within an international business environment. We applied divergent & convergent thinking in investigating the given problem and identified possible solutions which were recommended to the university.

contributors.headline: Currently pursuing Msc at Erasmus University Rotterdam
FinTech, Accounting, Financial Statement Analysis, Managerial Decision Making

courses.name: Managerial Decision Making in Finance & Accounting

profile_positions.description: Following my 6-month internship experience within the UF/System Sales team, I was accepted to pursue my thesis within this team. This research internship entailed a financial and operational final thesis within ASML’s UF/System Sales team in their Global Enabling Service department. The thesis topic revolved around process and performance improvement based on applications of Lean thinking and statistical data within the Six Sigma framework, relative to ASML’s system shipments.
profile_positions.title: Finance Research Intern

profile_positions.description: The high-tech/ semiconductor industry is a fast paced and dynamic environment which requires employees to be adaptive, proactive, and decisive to accommodate its changing conditions. This financial thesis involved executing operational activities within the UF/System Sales team in the Global Enabling Services department of ASML. As an operational intern, I assisted with the Quote-to-Cash process regarding product shipment documentation from the Veldhoven branch to ASML's customer countries. Moreover, I created, monitored, and analyzed the dashboards that include information of system sales for all of ASML’s clients, and executed 6 improvement projects where I worked with various departments and teams in- and outside the Netherlands branch. Moreover, I executed ad hoc accounting activities and issues that required manual corrections for International branches and departments. I worked with SAP GUI, MS Excel, AICO, and Spotfire.
profile_positions.title: Finance Intern

company.name: Enactus The Hague University of Applied Sciences

profile_positions.company: Enactus The Hague University of Applied Sciences
profile_positions.description:
Enactus is a global organisation for social entrepreneurship among students. Through the organisation, students grow social start-up projects into functioning businesses guided by the Sustainable Development Goals created by the UN. My role as chair in the board of Enactus THUAS involved overviewing the board and 3 project operations and communicating and representing the organisation to external parties for brand awareness, recruitment, and networking. My role also included strategizing and monitoring long term goals of the organisation based on funding, networking, organisational growth, and member development.
Additionally, I led the presenting teams for the Enactus World cup, co-writing their scripts and presentations, while providing constructive criticism and feedback.
profile_positions.title: Chairperson

profile_positions.company: Enactus The Hague University of Applied Sciences
profile_positions.description: Kids for compost is a social start-up project, aimed at teaching children the importance of sustainable living and composting. I was the co-leader of this project, working with a colleague to coordinate a project of 8 student -members. The role consisted of communicating and representing the start-up to the client schools we operated in, and the board who oversaw operations. I scheduled and conducted workshops in the schools while monitoring the quality of service, and client satisfaction. Additionally, the role involved supervising the goals set for the project, in which our project developed significant growth and funding.
profile_positions.title: Project Leader of Kids For Compost
